title: [To rel/1.0] [IOTDB-5068] Fix CompactionSchedulerTest
body:
See [IOTDB-5068](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5068).

The assertion at line 432 is not reasonable. Before this assertion, the test waits for all sequence space compaction task finish. After that, it asserts all unsequence files is compacted to sequence space, which doesn't have to happend, so it may fail some times.  We don't need this assertion, just remove it and the test has already assertted the num of sequence files and unsequence files in the end of the test.

title: [IOTDB-5068] Fix ComapctionSchedulerTest

After that, it asserts all unsequence files is compacted to sequence space, which doesn't have to happend, so it may fail some times.  We don't need this assertion, just remove it and the test has already assertted the num of sequence files and unsequence files in the end of the test.

Optimize insert statement generate
body:
## Description

Optimize tsbs insert performance.
set wal_mode=DISABLE
Before:
```
Summary:
loaded 78537600 metrics in 75.496sec with 1 workers (mean rate 1040289.76 metrics/sec)
loaded 6998400 rows in 75.496sec with 1 workers (mean rate 92699.09 rows/sec)
```
After
```
Summary:
loaded 78537600 metrics in 29.084sec with 1 workers (mean rate 2700401.36 metrics/sec)
loaded 6998400 rows in 29.084sec with 1 workers (mean rate 240629.82 rows/sec)
```

title: Skip checking duplicated measurements in one write request
[IOTDB-5004] [Metrics] Fix the seq file size in grafana is inconsistent with the actual query
body:
See [IOTDB-5004](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5004).

The reason for this bug is that, when reducing the size of deleted tsfile after compaction, the deleted files return a size of zero. This pr fixes it by calculating the total size of deleted file before they are deleted, and reducing it after deletion of the files.

[IOTDB-5049] Add parameters enable leader balance for specifed consensus protocol class
body:
Add parameters:

1.  **enable_auto_leader_balance_for_ratis:** enable balance the RegionGroups' leaders for Ratis consensus protocol, default is false since the Ratis is unstable for this function.
2. **enable_auto_leader_balance_for_multileader:** enable balance the RegionGroups' leaders for MultiLeader consensus protocol, default is true since the MultiLeader is depends on this function to distribute leader.

title: Ratis Client Retry on TimeoutIOE
remove log
[IOTDB-5034] Change log level
body:
# Why change log level

Currently RatisConsensus treats failed consensus operations all as error level. However, some failures are expected and can be retries by caller. So I changed the level to INFO, leaving the ERROR/WARN decision to caller.

title: add log
[IOTDB-4066] Allocate new RegionGroups through double keyword sort
body:
Embed the double keyword sort algorithm into the RegionGroup allocation process:

1. First key: select the DataNode that currently has the minimum number of Regions.
2. Second key: select the DataNode that currently has the maximum free disk space.

You can see the [RegionGroup allocation algorithm](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnHuDkDD6RiwLjaej3hkA9Vb) doc to get more details of this algorithm.

To varify this test, I also enhance the GreedyRegionGroupAllocatorTest. But the ClusterIT framework is hard to simulate this scenario since we can't specific the DataNode's disk space in ClusterIT framework currently.

title: Fix abstract map bug when remove failing measurement
body:
## Description


The abstract map, generated by Collections.singletonMap, is immutable, which will bring exception  when the schema registration check try to remove failing measurement from it. 

Therefore, replace it with hashmap.

title: [IOTDB-5031] Make snapshot taking in shutdown hook parallel
body:
See [IOTDB-5031](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5031).

Trigger a snapshot when shutting down IoTDB could help reserve the compaction result, this pr makes it parallel to accelerate thisp process.

title: [IOTDB-4334] Verify durable cases of RegionGroup extension
body:
**Algorithm:**

When received new Partitions creation requests and there are not available RegionGroups in the corresponding StorageGroup, we should **create a new RegionGroup** to ensure the new Partition can be created successfully.

Since the related function is completed in previous PRs, I just enhance the IoTDBPartitionDurableIT in this PR. You can see the [RegionGroup allocation algorithm](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnHuDkDD6RiwLjaej3hkA9Vb) doc to get more details of relevant algorithm.

**Updates:**

1. testRemovingDataNode: set a DataNode to Removing status, the newborn RegionGroup should keep away from the Removing one.
2. testReadOnlyDataNode: set a DataNode to ReadOnly status, the newborn RegionGroup should keep away from the ReadOnly one.
3. testUnknownDataNode: shutdown a DataNode, the RegionGroup should still create successfully, and the RegionMaintainer can re-create the releated Regions.

title: [IOTDB-5019] Fix releasing wal files after flushing memtable
[IOTDB-5028] Using `show timeseries` to query the schema in import-csv
[IOTDB-5029] Rename SQL "MERGE" and "FULL MERGE" to "COMPACT"
body:
See [IOTDB-5029](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5029).

Current sql "MERGE" and "FULL MERGE" trigger compaction scheduling, and there is no difference between them. So we don't need two different sql. What's more, merge is an out-of-date name of compaction, it's better to rename "merge" to "compact".
